meanings.definition: To immerse briefly in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: She was dabbling her fingers in the cool water of the stream.
meanings.sent2: The children were dabbling in the puddles after the rain.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally spilled his drink and ended up dabbling his hand in it.
meanings.sent4: The artist was dabbling her brush in different shades of blue.
meanings.sent5: The chef was dabbling the spoon in the soup to taste it.

meanings.definition: To take part in an activity in a casual or superficial way.
meanings.sent1: She was dabbling in painting, trying it out for fun.
meanings.sent2: The students were dabbling in various sports before finding their favorite.
meanings.sent3: He was dabbling in gardening but didn't know the names of the plants.
meanings.sent4: The musician was dabbling in different genres to explore his style.
meanings.sent5: The writer was dabbling in poetry to express her emotions.
